title: [BUG] Pixel-accurate rendering not possible on WPF SKElement
body:
**Description**

When using the `SKElement` on WPF, there seems to be some internal scaling interpolation going on, which prevents pixel-accurate rendering.

**Code**

Just draw some lines and display using `SKElement`.

**Expected Behavior**
Sharp, pixel-accurate lines (image in 4x zoom):

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18097859/79539376-7da28f80-8086-11ea-9a51-7c72dfeb3208.png)


**Actual Behavior**
Lines are more or less blurry, depending on the offset of WPF units to physical device pixels.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18097859/79539419-914df600-8086-11ea-92ba-ed0aa122dabc.png)

**Basic Information**

- Version with issue: 1.68.2-preview.60 
- Last known good version:  -
- IDE:  Visual Studio
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
  - Windows Classic:  WPF on Windows 10

**Fix**

- call `RenderOptions.SetBitmapScalingMode(this, BitmapScalingMode.NearestNeighbor);` in constructor of `SKElement` (cf. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.windows.media.imaging.writeablebitmap?view=netframework-4.8)
- Replace https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/blob/2550d14410839ebba2d541ec5b423261b9236197/source/SkiaSharp.Views/SkiaSharp.Views.WPF/SKElement.cs#L79 by `drawingContext.DrawImage(bitmap, new Rect(0, 0, size.Width / scaleX, size.Height / scaleY));` to make sure rendered height matches physical height
